business.headline: A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Watch: Trailblazers awarded at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024Business Today unveiled the 21st edition of its Most Powerful Women in Business list on Friday, celebrating 60 exceptional women leaders who are pioneering change, driving growth, and inspiring progress across diverse industries. This year's edition brings in 12 fresh faces and recognises four returning achievers, underscoring the dynamic nature of leadership in business. Watch the award ceremony here on India Today.

I salute the trailblazers: Kalli Purie at Business Today's Most Powerful Women eventKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, lauded the growing accomplishments and transformation of women leaders in India.

Trailblazers on Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 listThis year's Business Today Most Powerful Women list introduces 12 new faces, four returning achievers, and 37 repeat honourees from last year. Two trailblazers entered the MPW Hall of Fame after seven-time wins.

Americans can learn a lesson or two from India: Piyush Goyal on women representationUnion Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal lauded India's approach to women's empowerment and said that Americans can learn a lesson or two from India on women representation.

Harley-Davidson tariffs to be cut after Trump's return? Piyush Goyal respondsSpeaking at the Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Piyush Goyal expressed India's openness to reconsidering the tariffs on the iconic motorcycles.

Women leaders share insights on achieving work-life balance and success at BT MPW 2024At the Business Today MPW 2024 session, Ritu Arora, CEO & CIO of Allianz Investment Management, Asia Pacific, Nirupa Shankar, Joint MD of Brigade Group; and Devita Saraf, Chairperson & CEO of Vu Group, shared insights on striking a fine balance between work, life, health and wealth.

Women need to move from being savers to investors: Radhika GuptaSpeaking at the Business Today Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Radhika Gupta, MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, emphasised the need for women to move beyond saving and start investing.

It's not complicated: Radhika Gupta urges women to manage their own moneySpeaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Edelweiss Mutual Fund Managing Director and CEO Radhika Gupta said that while women have been the "chief financial officers" of their households for generations, it's time to extend that role into the financial markets.

Women have always had a tough time breaking barriers in business: Padmaja Ruparel at BT MPW 2024Speaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Padmaja Ruparel said women always had a tough time breaking barriers in business.

Zomato, Swiggy accused of unfair practices in food delivery market: ReportThe investigation found these companies implemented practices that gave preferential treatment to certain restaurants on their platforms.
Sensex, Nifty end in red as FII selling offsets IT gains; RVNL tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 55.47 points to settle at 79,486.32, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 89.95 points to 24,109.40.

Shiv Nadar, billionaire with a big heart, donates Rs 2,153 crore in FY24For the third time in five years, Shiv Nadar and his family have topped the EdelGive-Hurun India Philanthropy List 2024, contributing Rs 2,153 crore in the fiscal year 2024.

Sharan Hegde of 1% Club faces criticism after laying off 15% employeesPopular finfluencer Sharan Hegde is facing backlash after announcing layoffs at his company, 1% Club. His LinkedIn post has drawn criticism from many on social media.

Indian Hotels share price jumps over 6% to hit 1-year high. Buy, hold or sell?Indian Hotels share price: After a softer June quarter, the Tata group's hospitality arm showed strong recovery, buoyed by wedding-driven demand in Mumbai and pent-up bookings delayed by Q1's election and weather impacts.

Reliance Power share price hits 5% lower circuit after major setback. Details hereReliance Power shares have faced significant volatility this year. The stock has surged by 103% over the past year, reaching a 52-week high of Rs 54.25 in early October.

Trent share price continues to fall. Should you buy, sell or hold? At 11:24 am, Trent's share price was down 2.69% to Rs 6,323.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In the previous session, Trent shares fell 8%.

Explained: Why Ircon International share price slipped 5% after Q2 resultsFor the July-September quarter, Ircon reported a standalone net profit of Rs 202.22 crore, down 12.2% year-on-year (YoY). Revenue from operations also saw a steep fall, dropping 20.3% YoY to Rs 2,298.86 crore.

Gold, silver price today, November 8, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today November 8, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Explained: Why RVNL share price plunged over 7% today Earlier this week, on November 6, RVNL secured a new contract valued at over Rs 180 crore from East Central Railway, signaling continued project activity despite the current challenges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Harley-Davidson tariffs to be cut after Trump's return? Piyush Goyal respondsSpeaking at the Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Piyush Goyal expressed India's openness to reconsidering the tariffs on the iconic motorcycles.

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Trailblazers on Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 listThis year's Business Today Most Powerful Women list introduces 12 new faces, four returning achievers, and 37 repeat honourees from last year. Two trailblazers entered the MPW Hall of Fame after seven-time wins.

1st T20I: Samson 107, Varun magic inspire India's Durban demolition jobSouth Africa vs India: A terrific hundred from Sanju Samson and a superb middle-overs block from Varun Chakravarthy guided India to a commanding win against South Africa in Durban. The Suryakumar Yadav-led team won the first T20I by 61 runs to take 1-0 lead in the series.

Indians stuffed in train toilets, China moves billions with little fussMillions of travellers get added in India during the festive season, putting pressure on the railway network. But how has China managed its lunar holiday travellers, which is much higher than India's? This is the bigger story behind people stuffed in train toilets in India.

Khalistanis present in Canada, admits Trudeau, says not all Hindus Modi backersAmid the ongoing diplomatic row between India and Canada, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau accepted the presence of Khalistani supporters on Canadian soil, adding that they do not represent the Sikh community as a whole in the country.

Trolls will now be unemployed, Chief Justice Chandrachud quips at farewellAt the farewell organised by the Supreme Court Bar Association, DY Chandrachud shared personal anecdotes and reflections from his 24-year judicial career. He ended the speech on a humourous note, calling himself "one of the most trolled judges."

Press must draw 'Lakshman Rekha', ensure against media trial: Kerala High CourtThe Kerala High Court ruled that the media has the right to freedom of speech and expression but cannot assume the role of a court, under the guise of this right.

Not just wives: Stars of hit Netflix show on how they built their fabulous livesThe stars of Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives spoke in a session at Business Today's Most Powerful Women event. Shalini Passi, Maheep Kapoor, Seema Sajdeh, and Bhavana Pandey joined in to discuss the Netflix show, their lives as popular wives, and more.

'Fake': India on viral post urging Indians to confront Khalistanis in CanadaThe fake post alleged that suggestions were being given in it that the Indian community in Canada needs to be "mobilised" and that diaspora organisations, some of which have been named, could be "cultivated as a vital force" to confront pro-Khalistani elements.

100 ACs, 76 Bose speakers, jacuzzis: BJP gives peek into opulent Chief Minister houseA video posted on X by BJP's IT Cell chief Amit Malviya lists the range of opulent items found at the Delhi Chief Minister's residence. It was vacated by Arvind Kejriwal after he stepped down as Chief Minister in October.

Deccan to Durban: Sanju Samson becomes 1st Indian to hit back-to-back T20I tonsSouth Africa vs India, 1st T20I: Sanju Samson continued from where he left in Hyderabad as he began the T20I series in South Africa with a 47-ball hundred in Durban on November 8. Samson became only the fourth Indian to hit multiple hundreds in T20I cricket.
A Maruti car finally has 5 star safety ratingThe new Dzire is the maiden model from Maruti Suzuki to have garnered a five-star Global NCAP safety rating.

Israeli football fans faced hit-and-run attacks in Amsterdam, rescue planes rushedSeveral Israeli football fans were victims of overnight hit-and-run attacks by unidentified miscreants in Amsterdam after a Europa League match as violence swept the Dutch capital late Thursday night.

Rahul an unguided missile, urge Sonia Gandhi to coach him: Himanta SarmaSpeaking to the media in poll-bound Jharkhand, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma equated Congress MP and Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, an "unguided missile" and urged senior Congress leader Sonia Gandhi to train him.

Tears, laughs at Chief Justice Chandrachud's farewell: Forgive me if I hurt anyoneOn his last working day, Chief Justice DY Chandrachud reflected on his journey in the judiciary and ended his short speech by asking forgiveness from those he might have unintentionally hurt.

Avoiding flower-pot roles: Samantha on fair representation of women in filmsActor Samantha was present at Business Today's Most Powerful Women in Business 2024 event, where she spoke about making conscious efforts to choose roles that give a fair representation of women in society. She referred to her series, Citadel: Honey Bunny, and talked about working in an action genre which is largely male-dominated.

It's not complicated: Radhika Gupta urges women to manage their own moneySpeaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Edelweiss Mutual Fund Managing Director and CEO Radhika Gupta said that while women have been the "chief financial officers" of their households for generations, it's time to extend that role into the financial markets.

When battle-hardened Trump funded Kamala Harris's election campaignDonald Trump, now a right-wing Republican, switched sides regularly. He was once a registered Democrat and had a soft corner for the party he now bashes. Trump also funded the campaigns of Kamala Harris, twice. The same Harris he would go on to defeat in the 2024 presidential election.

PM dares MVA alliance to get Congress to praise 'Maharashtra's pride' SavarkarPM Modi challenged the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) to make Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, to pubically praise VD Savarkar and Hindutva scion Bal Thackeray.

Good Doctor to Extraordinary Attorney Woo: How K-dramas portray autism rightSouth Korean dramas have mastered the art of setting high standards, whether it's showcasing ideal male leads or addressing mental health with sensitivity and depth. Over the years, these dramas have evolved, offering increasingly nuanced portrayals of complex and sensitive topics, like autism. Let's take a closer look at how they've achieved this and why they resonate so deeply with audiences worldwide.

Zomato, Swiggy accused of unfair practices in food delivery market: ReportThe investigation found these companies implemented practices that gave preferential treatment to certain restaurants on their platforms.

Why Samson has more chances of succeeding under Gambhir-Suryakumar eraIndia's T20I series against South Africa offers Sanju Samson a crucial platform to secure his spot as wicketkeeper-batter, with strong backing from coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Suryakumar Yadav boosting his confidence ahead of the challenge.

Hindu reformer raja who donated land for AMU defeated Vajpayee in pollsA legal battle is on over Aligarh Muslim University's (AMU's) minority tag. The story of Raja Mahendra Pratap Singh, who gave land for the AMU campus, is almost forgotten amid this controversy. Singh was a freedom fighter, a reformer and a politician who defeated Jana Sangh's Atal Bihari Vajpayee in polls in 1957.

Turkey film festival cancelled over ban on Daniel Craig's gay film QueerMubi Fest Istanbul was cancelled as a protest against the local authority's ban on the film Queer, starring Daniel Craig, citing it as provocative content.

Grammy nominations 2025: Beyonce leads with 11 nods for Cowboy CarterSinger Beyonce dominated the 2025 Grammy nominations with 11 nods for her country album Cowboy Carter. Taylor Swift and Billie Eilish will also compete for top prizes.

Pics: Glamorous Bollywood Wives, and Shalini Passi, at Women in Business AwardsThe cast of Fabulous Life Vs Bollywood Wives - Shalini Passi, Neelam Kothari, Maheep Kapoor, Seema Sajdeh, and Bhavana Pandey - were a part of Business Today's Women in Business Awards, where they spoke about the Netflix show, their glamorous lives and their entrepreneurial journey.

Samantha says Priyanka Chopra a role model: She teaches us to think bigSamantha described Priyanka Chopra as an inspiring role model who encouraged thinking big. She also shared her experience of working with Raj and DK on Citadel: Honey Bunny.

sports.headline: Boucher highlights Miller's struggle vs spin: Could not pick a thing at allMark Boucher emphasized South Africa's struggles against spin as India's Ravi Bishnoi and Varun Chakravarthy exploited Kingsmead conditions expertly, leading to a decisive 61-run victory in the T20I series opener in Durban on November 8.

If we can score 200 in 17 overs, then why not? Surya backs batting intentSA vs IND: India skipper Suryakumar Yadav backed the team's aggressive intent with the bat despite a batting collapse late in the 1st innings. Surya said that if the team can score 200 in 17 overs, then why wait till the end?

Rohit Sharma set to travel to Australia, but Perth Test participation uncertain: SourcesIndia captain Rohit Sharma is set to travel to Australia with the team. Sharma, who is expecting a child with wife Ritika might miss the first Test match in Perth vs Australia.

1st T20I: Samson 107, Varun magic inspire India's Durban demolition jobSouth Africa vs India: A terrific hundred from Sanju Samson and a superb middle-overs block from Varun Chakravarthy guided India to a commanding win against South Africa in Durban. The Suryakumar Yadav-led team won the first T20I by 61 runs to take 1-0 lead in the series.

Team India, fans show spirit after national anthem stops in Durban SA vs IND, 1st T20I: The Indian players and the fans showed a lot of heart after the national anthem went off before the first T20I on Friday at the Kingsmead in Durban.

Boucher hails 'special' Sanju Samson: This is what he needsFormer South Africa cricketer and coach Mark Boucher had the brilliant innings from Sanju Samson. Boucher hoped that Samson gets confidence from his century and goes on to have a long career for India.

Afghanistan vs Bangladesh, 2nd ODI: When and where to watch live?AFG vs BAN: Hashmatullah Shahidi's Afghanistan and Najmul Hossain Shanto's Bangladesh will face off in the second ODI on Saturday at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium.

BCCI conducts 6-hour review meeting with Gambhir, Rohit after NZ whitewashThe BCCI has conducted an exhaustive review of India's shock 0-3 debacle against New Zealand. Skipper Rohit Sharma, chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar, and head coach Gambhir were in attendance along with BCCI secretary Jay Shah.

Stat Pack: Sanju Samson breaks Rohit Sharma's record in Durban blitz SA vs IND, 1st T20I: Sanju Samson scored his second T20I hundred, scoring 107 runs off 50 balls with seven fours and 10 sixes against South Africa at the Kingsmead in Durban. Earlier, he also made a century against Bangladesh in Hyderabad.

Redemption like Rohit: Fans praise Samson after Durban T20I hundredSanju Samson's record-breaking century in Durban was a game-changer, making him the first Indian wicketkeeper to score back-to-back T20I hundreds, solidifying his place as a crucial player in India's T20I future.

Deccan to Durban: Sanju Samson becomes 1st Indian to hit back-to-back T20I tonsSouth Africa vs India, 1st T20I: Sanju Samson continued from where he left in Hyderabad as he began the T20I series in South Africa with a 47-ball hundred in Durban on November 8. Samson became only the fourth Indian to hit multiple hundreds in T20I cricket.

Afghanistan vs Bangladesh, 2nd ODI: When and where to watch live?AFG vs BAN: Hashmatullah Shahidi's Afghanistan and Najmul Hossain Shanto's Bangladesh will face off in the second ODI on Saturday at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium.

Skipper Rohit Sharma, chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar, and head coach Gambhir were in attendance along with BCCI secretary Jay Shah.

Earlier, he also made a century against Bangladesh in Hyderabad.

Deccan to Durban: Sanju Samson becomes 1st Indian to hit back-to-back T20I tonsSouth Africa vs India, 1st T20I: Sanju Samson continued from where he left in Hyderabad as he began the T20I series in South Africa with a 47-ball hundred in Durban on November 8. Samson became only the fourth Indian to hit multiple hundreds in T20I cricket.

Sanju Samson faster than MS Dhoni to score 7000 runs in T20sSA vs IND, 1st T20I: Sanju Samson became the joint seventh-fastest Indian batter to reach the landmark of 7000 runs in T20s. He got to the landmark in the opening T20I against South Africa at the Kingsmead in Durban.

Abhishek Sharma like Sehwag, can't expect too much consistency from him: UthappaSouth Africa vs India: Former India batter Robin Uthappa said Abhishek Sharma deserves to be given a free hand to play his natural game and the team management should not expect 'too much consistency' from the aggressive opener. Abhishek was dismissed for 7 in the powerplay in the first T20I in Durban.

India players thinking of IPL auction in South Africa? Suryakumar answersSuryakumar Yadav acknowledged that IPL 2025 auction thoughts exist, but emphasized that India's focus remains on their crucial T20I series against South Africa, where breakout stars will also aim to showcase their international potential.

No debutants as Axar Patel returns for Durban T20I vs South Africa SA vs IND: Axar Patel has returned to playing for India in the opening T20I against South Africa at the Kingsmead in Durban. Axar hasn't played T20Is since the series in Sri Lanka earlier this year.

Ancelotti gives positive update on Endrick and Guler's Madrid futureCarlo Ancelotti has confirmed that young stars Endrick and Arda Güler will be given opportunities to shine for Real Madrid, as the coach aims to address recent criticism following consecutive defeats in La Liga and the Champions League.

Virat Kohli's aggression must coexist with patience, focus in Australia: ChappellIndia tour of Australia: Legendary Gregg Chappell recalled his conversation with Sachin Tendulkar about why it gets difficult for ageing batters to score consistently. Chappell urged Virat Kohli to be as aggressive as he has been while being more patient in the middle with the bat.

If I am injury free, then definitely I will compete in LA Olympics: Sindhu PV Sindhu said that she has hopes of returning to play for India in the Los Angeles Olympics four years later. The 29-year-old crashed out in the Round of 16 in Paris after losing to He Bing Jiao.

Ancelotti gives positive update on Endrick and Guler's Madrid futureCarlo Ancelotti has confirmed that young stars Endrick and Arda Güler will be given opportunities to shine for Real Madrid, as the coach aims to address recent criticism following consecutive defeats in La Liga and the Champions League.

Virat Kohli's aggression must coexist with patience, focus in Australia: ChappellIndia tour of Australia: Legendary Gregg Chappell recalled his conversation with Sachin Tendulkar about why it gets difficult for ageing batters to score consistently. Chappell urged Virat Kohli to be as aggressive as he has been while being more patient in the middle with the bat.

If I am injury free, then definitely I will compete in LA Olympics: Sindhu PV Sindhu said that she has hopes of returning to play for India in the Los Angeles Olympics four years later. The 29-year-old crashed out in the Round of 16 in Paris after losing to He Bing Jiao.

Neeraj Chopra set to fly for off-season training in South AfricaIndia's javelin ace Neeraj Chopra gears up for the 2025 season with an off-season training camp in South Africa's Potchefstroom, aiming to defend his World Championship title and break the elusive 90m barrier after an injury-hit year.

1st T20I Highlights: Samson, Varun and Bishnoi shine in India's 61-run winSouth Africa (SA) vs. India (IND), 1st T20I Live Updates and Reactions from Durban: India completed a dominating win by 61-runs over South Africa in their T20I series opener in Durban, where the likes of Sanju Samson, Varun Chakravarthy and Ravi Bishnoi shone bright. Samson's century did the groundwork for India's win, only for Varun and Bishnoi to fully take advantage of a lacklustre South Africa batting unit.

Uthappa wants Cheteshwar Pujara back in Test team for Australia tourFormer India cricketer Robin Uthappa wants Cheteshwar Pujara back in the Indian Test team. Uthappa believes that India need a batter who has an airtight defence.

Why Samson has more chances of succeeding under Gambhir-Suryakumar eraIndia's T20I series against South Africa offers Sanju Samson a crucial platform to secure his spot as wicketkeeper-batter, with strong backing from coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Suryakumar Yadav boosting his confidence ahead of the challenge.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
